Warren Peeples Jr. (born June 14, 2001) is an American professional football outside linebacker for the Tampa Bay Buccaneers of the National Football League (NFL). He played college football for the Hutchinson Blue Dragons, the Highland Scotties, the Memphis Tigers, the Northern Iowa Panthers and the Southeastern Louisiana Lions.
Early life and high school
Peeples grew up in Stone Mountain, Georgia and attended South Gwinnett High School in Snellville, Georgia, where he lettered in football and track & field.
College career
Hutchinson CC
Peeples began his collegiate career at Hutchinson Community College in 2020. He played in five games and tallied seven tackles, contributing to the Blue Dragons' NJCAA national championship victory.
Highland CC
In 2021, Peeples transferred to Highland Community College. He had a standout season, playing in nine games and leading the NJCAA with 12.5 sacks and recording 42 total tackles. His performance earned him All-Kansas Jayhawk Community College Conference honors.
Memphis
Peeples joined the Memphis Tigers for the 2022 season. He appeared in six games, recording four tackles, all against North Alabama.
Northern Iowa
In 2023, Peeples transferred to Northern Iowa. He played in seven games, tallying four tackles, including 1.5 tackles for loss.
Southeastern Louisiana
Peeples concluded his collegiate career at Southeastern Louisiana in 2024. He was the team's top pass rusher, recording five sacks (fifth in the Southland Conference), 33 tackles, 7.5 tackles for loss, and a forced fumble. His performance earned him First Team All-Southland Conference honors and second-team all-state recognition.
Professional career
}}
On May 9, 2025, Peeples signed with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers as an undrafted free agent after going unselected in the 2025 NFL draft.
